alert.note: Alert for Appling; Atkinson; Bacon; Brantley; Coffee; Jeff Davis; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Pierce; Wayne; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 5:23PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN COFFEE...PIERCE... EASTERN ATKINSON...SOUTHWESTERN BRANTLEY...NORTHERN WARE...BACON... WESTERN WAYNE...NORTH CENTRAL CHARLTON...SOUTHEASTERN JEFF DAVIS AND APPLING COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 523 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Graham to 6 miles southeast of Pearson. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Waycross, Baxley, Alma, Blackshear, Pearson, Patterson, Graham, Surrency, Plant Hatch, and Nicholls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Appling; Atkinson; Bacon; Brantley; Coffee; Jeff Davis; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Pierce; Wayne; Western Charlton
